description: From Medieval Latin syllabizō, from Ancient Greek σῠλλᾰβῐ́ζω (sullabízō), from σῠλλᾰβή (sullabḗ, “syllable”) + -ῐ́ζω (-ízō, “-ize”).

verbs.description: syllabize (third-person singular simple present syllabizes, present participle syllabizing, simple past and past participle syllabized)

examples: No pupil who will syllabize and pronounce carefully will misspell such words as "accommodate" and "professor."
